abstract: The big lender turned down an offer from the financier Carl C. Icahn, saying it was not confident of its solidity or Mr. Icahn’s backing.
snippet: The big lender turned down an offer from the financier Carl C. Icahn, saying it was not confident of its solidity or Mr. Icahn’s backing.
lead_paragraph: The troubled lender CIT Group said Wednesday that it had accepted a $4.5 billion loan from a group of investors that included some of its biggest bondholders, shunning a similar offer by the financier Carl C. Icahn.

headline.main: CIT Rejects Icahn Offer; Its Creditors Extend Loan
headline.print_headline: CIT Rejects Icahn Offer; Its Creditors Extend Loan

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
